hero.title: Accessibility in Practice
hero.subtitle: WCAG 2.1 AA in the real world
hero.description: Practical guide with real code examples taken from this project: ARIA, focus, HTML semantics, contrast and a checklist for every PR.
hero.warning: This guide focuses on development best practices. For professional accessibility auditing, consult a certified WCAG specialist.

aria.title: ARIA Roles, Labels & Live Regions
aria.description: ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) complements HTML where native semantics are insufficient. Use only when necessary — semantic HTML is always preferred.
aria.liveDesc: For content that updates dynamically without a page reload:

roles.note: Combine with aria-modal="true" and focus trap

liveRegions.desc: Reads when user stops typing. Ideal for notifications.
Reads immediately. Only for critical errors.

focus.title: Focus Management
focus.description: Keyboard users depend on visible and predictable focus. Focus traps, skip links and return to origin element are essential.
focus.skipLinkDesc: The first focusable element on the page — allows jumping to the main content without navigating through the entire navigation.
focus.trapDesc: While a modal is open, Tab and Shift+Tab should cycle only within the modal.
focus.visibleDesc: Never remove the focus outline without providing a visible substitute. This project uses Tailwind focus-visible.
rules: On modal open: move focus to the first interactive element
On modal close: return focus to the element that opened it
Tab should cycle within the modal (focus trap)
Escape should close and return focus
Use focus-visible instead of focus to avoid affecting mouse/touch

semantics.title: Semantic HTML
semantics.description: Correct semantic HTML is the foundation of accessibility. Screen readers use landmarks for quick navigation.
semantics.landmarksDesc: Each landmark creates a navigation point for screen readers.
semantics.headingsDesc: One h1 per page, don't skip levels. Screen readers use headings to navigate content.

contrast.title: Color Contrast — WCAG AA
contrast.description: WCAG 2.1 AA requires a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text (18pt or 14pt bold).

checklist.title: Accessibility Checklist for PRs
checklist.description: Review these items before opening a Pull Request with any UI change.

items.label: All buttons have descriptive text or aria-label
Images have alt text (or alt="" if decorative)
Visible focus on all interactive elements
Modals have focus trap and close with Escape
Dynamic content uses aria-live or role="alert"

cta.title: Accessibility is for Everyone
cta.description: 1 in 6 people in the world has some form of disability. Accessible code is not optional — it's professional responsibility.
